revised_title: The Stones of Venice: A Journey Through Earth Sciences and Cultural History
tldr: This article explores the life and work of John Strange, an 18th-century British amateur earth scientist, art collector, and diplomat in Venice. Strange's correspondence and fieldwork in Italy contributed to the development of earth sciences and provided insights into the cultural and intellectual life of the time. The article highlights the importance of networks and communication in the advancement of natural knowledge during the Enlightenment era.
